resources.string: You must find every location pointed to by the clues. The app will time your attempt.
You may request a hint for every clue. Like clues, hints use indirect language.
Press the \"Found It!\" button once you have found the location
If you are wrong, a pop-up will inform you. The timer will not stop during the pop-up.
If you are correct, a screen will inform you. The timer will be paused on this screen.
For this specific treasure hunt, you will likely need a car and ample of time. All locations are in Oregon.
You can quit the treasure hunt at any time.
Park near a crack in the ground
Live in a chateau at the dread river of oath

Unlike most ancient volcanic fissures, Crack-in-the-Ground exists today nearly the same as it did thousands of years ago because the arid region around it prevented much filling from occurring. It reaches over 2 miles long and up to 70 feet deep, with a trail along the fissure\'s bottom to hike through and cool off.

The Chateau at the Oregon Caves is located next to the Oregon Caves National Monument, which offers tours through one of the few marble caves in the Pacific Northwest of national significance. The marble of the caves lies in an isolated block within a faulted mixture of igneous, sedimentary, and metamorphic rocks. In the caves also lies the River Styx, the underground segment of Cave Creek.

The name "Witches Cauldron" was given by William Gladstone Steel in 1885, and it is located on Wizard Island, a volcanic cinder cone, which is situated at the west end of Crater Lake. Approximately 7700 years ago, Mount Mazama erupted violently, leaving behind the hole that became Crater Lake. Two hiking trails are available on Wizard Island.
